title: How a £4,000 midlife reset helped me find my mojo
text:
It’s the detox clinic that says yes to potatoes, no to phones, and is adored by the A-list. Now Vivamayr in Austria wants to help you get through the menopause unscathed. Leah Hardy checks in

Think about virtually any high-profile, preternaturally perky midlife woman – Elizabeth Hurley and Claudia Winkleman, not to mention Naomi Campbell and Kate Moss – and they have one thing in common: they’re all devotees of the world’s most- revered health clinics, the Vivamayr retreats in Austria.

Each of them signs up regularly for ‘the cure’ – a one- to three-week programme of strict food deprivation, no booze, daily laxatives (of which more later – I know), gentle exercise, early nights and fresh mountain...
description: It’s the detox clinic that says yes to potatoes, no to phones, and is adored by the A-list.
